contentrichtext.text: '''Oakland Mills''' is one of the 10 villages in [[Columbia, Maryland]]. It is located immediately east of Town Center, across [[US Route 29]].<ref>[http://www.columbiavillages.org/index.html "Map"], columbiavillages.org, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> Neighborhoods in the village of Oakland Mills include Steven's Forest, Talbott Springs, and Thunder Hill.<ref name=oakland>Kellner, Barbara.[http://columbiamaryland.com/noakm.htm "The Neighborhood of Oakland Mills"], columbiamaryland.com, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> ==Names== The name Oakland Mills comes from an old mill in the local area.<ref name=oakland/> Steven's Forest is named for a land grant of a similar name, Stevens's Forest, patented to Charles Stevens in 1709. Streets in Steven's Forest are named for works of [[John Dos Passos]], [[F. Scott Fitzgerald]], and [[Ernest Hemingway]].<ref name=oakland/> Talbott Springs comes from the name of the land grant, Talbott's Resolution Manor, which bordered the area. Street names are taken from the works of [[Carl Sandburg]], and [[Ralph Waldo Emerson]].<ref name=oakland/> Thunder Hill derives from the name of the area farm of landowner Goldsmith. The street names are from [[Andrew Wyeth]].<ref name=oakland/> ==Services== The village center contains a [[Food Lion]] grocery store and other retail establishments.<ref>[http://www.oaklandmills.org/./node/53 "Oakland Mills Shop and Dine"], oaklandmills.org, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> "The Meeting House", located at the village center, is an interfaith center.<ref>[http://www.themeetinghouse.org/ "The Meeting House"], themeetinghouse.org, accessed May 31, 2009</ref> The community center is in The Other Barn, which was once part of the Owings Dorsey Dairy Farm.<ref>[http://www.oaklandmills.org/node/5 "The Other Barn"], oaklandmills.org, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> Each neighborhood has an outdoor pool.<ref>[http://www.columbiaassociation.net/living_playing/sports_fitness/facilities/outdoor_pools.htm "Outdoor Pools"], columbiaassociation.net, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> The Columbia Ice Rink is also part of the Oakland Mills Village Center complex, administered by the Columbia Association. ==Education== [[Oakland Mills High School]] is located in the village; students from both Oakland Mills and [[Owen Brown, Columbia, Maryland|Owen Brown]] attend. There are three elementary schools, Stevens Forest Elementary School, Thunder Hill Elementary School, and Talbott Springs Elementary School, and one middle school, Oakland Mills Middle School, within the village.<ref>[http://www.oaklandmills.org/./node/20 "Schools"], oaklandmills.org, accessed May 30, 2009</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.columbiavillages.org/oaklandmills/ Oakland Mills Community Association] {{Columbia, Maryland}} {{Howard County, Maryland}} {{coord|39|12|43|N|76|50|43|W|display=title|type:city_region:MD-US}} [[Category:Columbia, Maryland]] [[Category:Populated places in Howard County, Maryland]]
